column5: Selects which of the ADCn_[7:0] inputs are to be sampled and converted
The ADC clock is divided by the CLKDIV value plus one to produce the clock for the A/D converter
Controls Burst mode

This field selects the number of clocks used for each conversion in Burst mode and the number of bits of accuracy of the result in the LS bits of ADDR, between 11 clocks (10 bits) and 4 clocks (3 bits).
Power mode
Controls the start of an A/D conversion when the BURST bit is 0
Controls rising or falling edge on the selected signal for the start of a conversion
Selects which of the ADCn_[7:0] inputs are to be sampled and converted
The ADC clock is divided by the CLKDIV value plus one to produce the clock for the A/D converter
Controls Burst mode

This field selects the number of clocks used for each conversion in Burst mode and the number of bits of accuracy of the result in the LS bits of ADDR, between 11 clocks (10 bits) and 4 clocks (3 bits).
Power mode
Controls the start of an A/D conversion when the BURST bit is 0
Controls rising or falling edge on the selected signal for the start of a conversion
When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADCn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the reference voltage on the VDDA pin
These bits contain the channel from which the LS bits were converted
This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits
This bit is set to 1 when an analog-to-digital conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the AD0/1CR register is written
When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADCn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the reference voltage on the VDDA pin
These bits contain the channel from which the LS bits were converted
This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits
This bit is set to 1 when an analog-to-digital conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the AD0/1CR register is written
These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion
When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts.
These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion
When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts.

These bits mirror the DONE status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel.
These bits mirror the OVERRRUN status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel.
This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.
